DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Malignant Neoplasm Regional Lymph Node Involvement Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a description (related to TNM staging) for the spread of malignant cells to one or more lymph nodes in the region surrounding the colon or rectum related to a tumor (atypical neoplastic cells).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colorectal Malignant Neoplasm Regional Lymph Node Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the connection by participation for a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic cells and a lymph node that drains lymph from the region surrounding the colon or the rectum.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Colorectal Malignant Neoplasm Regional Lymph Node Involvement Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a description (related to TNM staging) for the spread of malignant cells to one or more lymph nodes in the region surrounding the colon or rectum related to a tumor (atypical neoplastic cells).

PermissibleValues.value: Metastases in 1 to 3 regional lymph nodes (N1)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: METASTASES IN 1 TO 3 REGIONAL LYMPH NODES (N1)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: METASTASES IN 1 TO 3 REGIONAL LYMPH NODES (N1)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: METASTASES IN 1 TO 3 REGIONAL LYMPH NODES (N1)

PermissibleValues.value: Metastases in 4 or more regional lymph nodes (N2)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: METASTASES IN 4 OR MORE REGIONAL LYMPH NODES (N2)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: METASTASES IN 4 OR MORE REGIONAL LYMPH NODES (N2)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: METASTASES IN 4 OR MORE REGIONAL LYMPH NODES (N2)

PermissibleValues.value: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (NX)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: REGIONAL LYMPH NODES CANNOT BE ASSESSED (NX)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: REGIONAL LYMPH NODES CANNOT BE ASSESSED (NX)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: REGIONAL LYMPH NODES CANNOT BE ASSESSED (NX)

A general term that refers to a TNM finding of cancer metastases in several regional lymph nodes. The definition of N2 TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer it refers to metastases in 4-9 axillary lymph nodes; for cutaneous melanoma it refers to metastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes; for colorectal cancer it refers to metastases in 4 or more regional lymph nodes; and for bladder cancer it refers to metastases in multiple regional lymph nodes in the true pelvis.

Concepts.definition: A general term that refers to a TNM finding of cancer metastases in several regional lymph nodes. The definition of N2 TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer it refers to metastases in 4-9 axillary lymph nodes; for cutaneous melanoma it refers to metastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes; for colorectal cancer it refers to metastases in 4 or more regional lymph nodes; and for bladder cancer it refers to metastases in multiple regional lymph nodes in the true pelvis.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: N1 Stage Finding N1c Stage Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: N1 Stage Finding N1c Stage Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A general term that refers to a TNM finding of cancer metastases usually in a limited number of regional lymph nodes. The definition of N1 TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer it refers to micrometastases or metastases in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes; for cutaneous melanoma it refers to metastasis in 1 regional lymph node; for colorectal cancer it refers to metastases in 1-3 regional lymph nodes; and for bladder cancer it refers to metastasis in 1 regional lymph node in the true pelvis.: A general term that refers to a TNM finding of cancer metastases usually in a limited number of regional lymph nodes. The definition of N1c TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer it refers to metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes and in internal mammary lymph nodes with micrometastases or macrometastases detected by sentinel lymph node biopsy but not clinically detected; for colorectal cancer it refers to tumor deposit(s) in the subserosa, mesentery, or nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal tissues without regional lymph node metastasis.

Concepts.definition: A general term that refers to a TNM finding of cancer metastases usually in a limited number of regional lymph nodes. The definition of N1 TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer it refers to micrometastases or metastases in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes; for cutaneous melanoma it refers to metastasis in 1 regional lymph node; for colorectal cancer it refers to metastases in 1-3 regional lymph nodes; and for bladder cancer it refers to metastasis in 1 regional lymph node in the true pelvis.

A general term that refers to a TNM finding of cancer metastases usually in a limited number of regional lymph nodes. The definition of N1c TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer it refers to metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes and in internal mammary lymph nodes with micrometastases or macrometastases detected by sentinel lymph node biopsy but not clinically detected; for colorectal cancer it refers to tumor deposit(s) in the subserosa, mesentery, or nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal tissues without regional lymph node metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
